alert.note: Alert for Aroostook (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 13 at 7:55PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Northern Maine, including the following county, Aroostook. * WHEN...Until 400 AM EDT Friday. * IMPACTS...River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 755 PM EDT, gauge reports indicated an ice jam. Minor flooding is already occurring near the advisory area. - For St John River at Nine Mile Bridge: At 7:15pm the stage was 15.94 feet. Flood Stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
